meanings.definition: Interpret or explain the meaning of something.
meanings.sent1: She was construing the poem to understand its message.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy construing the lyrics of songs to find hidden meanings.
meanings.sent3: While construing the recipe, she accidentally added salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Construing the map, he realized he had been going in the wrong direction all along.
meanings.sent5: The detective was construing the cryptic message left at the crime scene.

meanings.definition: Analyze or understand the intention behind someone's actions.
meanings.sent1: He was construing her silence as a sign of disapproval.
meanings.sent2: Construing his smile, she knew he was hiding something.
meanings.sent3: She couldn't help but construe his sudden departure as a deliberate act.
meanings.sent4: Construing his behavior, she realized he was trying to impress her.
meanings.sent5: By construing his tone, she could tell he was being sarcastic.

meanings.definition: To understand or explain the meaning of something in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: She was construing his words as a veiled criticism.
meanings.sent2: Construing the painting, she saw it as a representation of hope.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but construe her laughter as mocking him.
meanings.sent4: Construing the situation, she decided to take a different approach.
meanings.sent5: By construing the data, he was able to draw insightful conclusions.
